endpoints.text: Public and private pay packages become comparable
Public pay and benefits continue to greatly exceed those of private sector

text: Nationals with appropriate skills and education

endpoints.text: Sufficient nationals with appropriate skills and education
Insufficient nationals with appropriate skills and education

text: Nationals' perception of social status in private sector jobs

endpoints.text: Nationals' perception of equivalent social status in public-private sector jobs
Nationals' perception of low social status in private sector jobs

text: Government political will to remain employer of first resort

endpoints.text: Government makes efforts to scale back public sector employment
Government maintains current scale of public sector employment

text: Availability and cost of specialized skilled expatriate labor

endpoints.text: Specialized skilled expatriate labor not readily available and/or too costly
Specialized skilled expatriate labor readily available and at reasonable cost

text: Fertility rates impact on job market

endpoints.text: Job seeking population continues to expand
Job seeking population stablizes or contracts
